summary:
14. Requests the Secretary-General to establish a capacity within the UN Political Office for Somalia (UNPOS) to monitor and enhance human rights protection in Somalia.

15. Supports efforts to develop security sector institutions in Somalia and requests the Special Representative of the Secretary-General (SRSG) to enhance coordination in this area.

16. Condemns human rights and international humanitarian law violations, calls on all parties to respect their obligations, and demands those responsible be brought to justice.

17. Reaffirms resolutions 1325 (2000), 1674 (2006), and 1738 (2006) on women, peace, and security, and protection of civilians in armed conflict.

18. Reaffirms resolution 1612 (2005) on children and armed conflict and recalls conclusions of the Security Council Working Group on Children in Armed Conflict.

19. Recalls the Economic and Social Council's role in providing information to the Security Council.

20. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
